item.title: Report X-2025030057
item.description:
Report X-2025030057

Identified by scraper @ 2025-03-05T18:18:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-02-26
  • City: INDIANAPOLIS
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: A fiberboard box was presented to the INDH spill office with an odor. While investigating the shipment the spill agent discovered that the metal can inside was damaged on the bottom chime causing a release. The shipment was placed into a steel salvage package a new declaration will be obtained for movement.

item.title: Report E-2025020217
item.description:
Report E-2025020217

Identified by scraper @ 2025-03-05T18:18:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-02-04
  • City: INDIANAPOLIS
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: CSX TRANSPORTATION, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 4000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 02/04/2025, at 14:20 hours, personnel in the CSXT Hawthorne Yard in Indianapolis, Indiana, discovered UTLX632003, tank car load of Sodium Hydroxide Solution, had residue adhering to the outside of the car. The car was isolated and the shipper, Shintech Louisiana LLC, was notified via CHEMTREC (Report #2025-0204-00181). HEPACO, a CSXT emergency response contractor, was dispatched to the scene and observed dried residue on the exterior of the car which appeared to have released from the tank car’s pressure relief valve. No active leaks or apparent defects were observed. HEPACO personnel decontaminated the exterior of the tank car. All actions were communicated to the shipper’s representative (Patrick Hill). The car was initially held at FRA’s request and subsequently moved under authority of an OTMA-1 (FRA-250213014).
